_header: A philosopher a good clerk secular
_description: Advice to an old gentleman who wished for a young wife, perhaps by Lydgate — seventy-two rhyme royal stanzas and Envoy of two 8-line stanzas

BLHar372.First Lines:
A philisophre a good clerk seculerhad a frend þat sum what was
                    aged…
BLHar372.Last Lines:
…farwel & worche as ferforthe as þou as
                    þou dareþat lif & godes take none abreggement
BLHar372.Note:
Unique witness; advice of an old gentleman who wished for a young wife;
                    72 rhyme royal stanzas and one 8-line stanza as envoy.
BLHar372.Attributed Title:
The prohemy of a Mariage betwix an olde man and a yong wif and the counsail
                        &c (f. 45, right margin beside first line); Explicit (f.
                    51)
